the United States was *wanting* to go to war with Japan

extent.charseq: the US was doing its best to avoid, or at the very least postpone, a war against Japan

ldc_scope.charseq: I've read quite a few more rational works describing how the US was doing its best to avoid, or at the very least postpone, a war against Japan, mainly because FDR was trying to provoke Hitler to war and didn't need a distraction on another distant front

extent.charseq: the two carriers operating out of Pearl at the moment were sent

ldc_scope.charseq: However, the two carriers operating out of Pearl at the moment were sent West with light escort, on possibly intersecting routes with the IJN Kido Butai, which had far more carriers and a far heavier escort

extent.charseq: the two carriers operating out of Pearl at the moment
the carriers out of harm's way, we not only have to grant FDR the full knowledge of Kido Butai's route of approach would not result in either USN carrier fleet getting caught in a hopeless battle

extent.charseq: the US wanted to go to war against Japan prior to 1941

ldc_scope.charseq: To make a very long story short, it is foolish to assume that the US wanted to go to war against Japan prior to 1941, considering the weight of evidence arguing against a US desire for war, and the overwhelming lack of evidence (not to mention rational thought) arguing for a US desire for war
Wasn't Japan just defending herself when she attacked the US

extent.charseq: Japan was being "driven into a corner" by sanctions, and had no choice but to attack the US

ldc_scope.charseq: This line of reasoning seems to derive from arguments that Japan was being "driven into a corner" by sanctions, and had no choice but to attack the US

extent.charseq: War I, Japan failed to recognize a fundamental shift in the attitudes of her former Imperial partners

ldc_scope.charseq: However, after World War I, Japan failed to recognize a fundamental shift in the attitudes of her former Imperial partners; they began a long, slow process of disengaging themselves from their former Imperial areas, from their colonies, in addition to outright stopping all expansions

extent.charseq: deaths of many of the idealistic leaders who had led Japan's rise to international prominence

ldc_scope.charseq: With the deaths of many of the idealistic leaders who had led Japan's rise to international prominence, and the refusal of the US to intervene in Asian affairs, in addition to the Bolshevik revolution and the stripping of possessions from Germany, Britain found herself alone in dealing with an increasingly aggressive Japan in the area

war put a tremendous strain on Japan

ldc_scope.charseq: The war put a tremendous strain on Japan (and was in fact opposed by more radically NATIONALISTIC elements, as taking away from the development of Japan's other possessions, particularly in the areas of scrap metal and fuel
Domestic consumption fell, consumer goods became scarce, and the use of materiale for war purposes ate into Japan's domestic industry

extent.charseq: Japan expanded into areas of China and Indochina

ldc_scope.charseq: Japan expanded into areas of China and Indochina which had no strategic value to her, but put her in a position to threaten British and Dutch possessions in the area; possessions that both those Allied nations needed in order to continue their fight against Hitler

extent.charseq: Japan to do well IF THE WAR IN CHINA

extent.charseq: China in 1937, Japan would embark on a war
